pageContext.claim: “$5 billion saved in the state of Minnesota alone [on taxes].”
pageContext.analysis: The source of this number is unclear. When asked about his sourcing, the president responded it was “according to whoever does that kind of thing.” H&R Block data showed that taxes in Minnesota decreased by 23.4% in 2018. More likely, Trump obtained this figure from the left-leaning Institute for Taxation and Economic Policy, which issued a report saying "we find that in 2019 more than half will flow to the richest 5 percent of taxpayers, and more than a quarter will flow to the richest one percent of taxpayers. In 2019, the average impact for the middle-fifth of taxpayers will be a tax cut of $800." In the specific case of Minnesota, the report calculated tax savings of $5.2 billion in 2019, with $1.1 billion going to the top one percent and $1.4 billion going to the next four percent. The average tax change would be a reduction of $1,950.
